based in Gaborone, Botswana
based in Gaborone, Botswana

supporting_quotes: In 2016, the then president of Botswana, Ian Khama, nominated Kenewendo to the Parliament of Botswana
where she was elected as a presidential nominee to parliament.
events.notes: Time marker, organization, and role are clearly linked.

quotes: Kenewendo was born in Motopi Village in the Boteti Area, in Botswana circa 1987.
In 2016, the then president of Botswana, Ian Khama, nominated Kenewendo to the Parliament of Botswana
On 4 April 2018, the new incoming president, Mokgweetsi Masisi, appointed Kenewendo as the new Minister of Investment, Trade and Industry.
In her capacity as minister, Kenewendo was appointed by United Nations Secretary General António Guterres in 2018 to the High-level Panel on Digital Cooperation

time_markers.text: When the United Kingdom assumed the presidency of the G7 in 2021
quotes: When the United Kingdom assumed the presidency of the G7 in 2021, Kenewendo was appointed by the country's Minister for Women and Equalities, Liz Truss, to a newly formed Gender Equality Advisory Council (GEAC)

Bogolo Kenewendo
Economist, Minister, Gender and Youth Activist [Botswana]
In 2022, she was appointed as the UN Climate Change High-Level Champions’ Special Advisor and Africa Director.

supporting_quotes: Bogolo J. Kenewendo is a global economist and strategic advisor who has served as the Cabinet Minister of Investment, Trade, and Industry and a specially elected member of Parliament in Botswana.
events.notes: Active roles with ongoing responsibilities in Botswana.

organizations.name: Chicago Council on Global Affairs
quotes: Bogolo Joy Kenewendo | Chicago Council on Global Affairs

organizations.name: UN High-Level Climate Champions team
quotes: She is currently championing climate action and finance as a catalyst for development in Africa and the global south in her role as Africa director and special advisor of the UN High-Level Climate Champions team.

organizations.name: G7 gender equality advisory council
quotes: She has received global recognition for her work, including being appointed as a member of the G7 gender equality advisory council and a member of United Nations Secretary-General António Guterres’ high-level panel on digital cooperation.

quotes: She has received global recognition for her work, including being appointed as a member of the G7 gender equality advisory council and a member of United Nations Secretary-General António Guterres’ high-level panel on digital cooperation.
Bogolo J. Kenewendo is a global economist and strategic advisor who has served as the Cabinet Minister of Investment, Trade, and Industry and a specially elected member of Parliament in Botswana.

She is currently championing climate action and finance as a catalyst for development in Africa and the global south in her role as Africa director and special advisor of the UN High-Level Climate Champions team.

She is currently championing climate action and finance as a catalyst for development in Africa and the global south in her role as Africa director and special advisor of the UN High-Level Climate Champions team.

supporting_quotes: with significant contributions made during her tenure as the Minister of Investment, Trade and Industry in Botswana from 2018-2019.
events.notes: Clear linkage between time, role, and location.

quotes: with significant contributions made during her tenure as the Minister of Investment, Trade and Industry in Botswana from 2018-2019.
In her role as Minister, Kenewendo was appointed by the United Nations Secretary-General António Guterres in 2018 to the High-level Panel on Digital Cooperation.
In 2022, she was further appointed as Special Advisor and Africa Director to the United Nations Climate Change High-Level Champions.

In 2022, she was named among Prestigious Time magazine’s TIME100 Next Honorees highlighting 100 emerging leaders from around the world who are shaping the future and defining the next generation of leadership.

supporting_quotes: On 4 April 2018, the new incoming president, Mokgweetsi Masisi, appointed Kenewendo as the new Minister of Investment, Trade and Industry.
events.notes: Time marker and role are clearly linked.

quotes: Kenewendo was born in Motopi Village in the Boteti Area, in Botswana circa 1987.
In 2016, the then president of Botswana, Ian Khama, nominated Kenewendo to the Parliament of Botswana
On 4 April 2018, the new incoming president, Mokgweetsi Masisi, appointed Kenewendo as the new Minister of Investment, Trade and Industry.
In her capacity as minister, Kenewendo was appointed by United Nations Secretary General António Guterres in 2018 to the High-level Panel on Digital Cooperation

time_markers.text: When the United Kingdom assumed the presidency of the G7 in 2021
quotes: When the United Kingdom assumed the presidency of the G7 in 2021, Kenewendo was appointed by the country's Minister for Women and Equalities, Liz Truss, to a newly formed Gender Equality Advisory Council (GEAC)

Bogolo Kenewendo
Economist, Minister, Gender and Youth Activist [Botswana]

Kenewendo worked as a trade economist ODI Fellow in the Ghanaian Ministry of Trade and Industry.
She also served as an economic consultant at Econsult Botswana, a Gaborone-based think tank.

supporting_quotes: She has received global recognition for her work, including being appointed as a member of the G7 gender equality advisory council and a member of United Nations Secretary-General António Guterres’ high-level panel on digital cooperation.
events.notes: Active membership with ongoing responsibilities.
